description: From Middle English puissaunt, from Middle French puissant, poissant, Anglo-Norman puissant, Old French pussant, et al., present participle of pooir (“to be able”), ultimately from Latin posse (“be able”).

adjectives.description: puissant (comparative more puissant, superlative most puissant)

entries.meaning: (archaic or literary) Powerful, mighty, having authority.
